Our courses provide a rich learning experience that will allow you to develop critical business skills in areas such as business... Read more...
title: Diploma in Marketing Analytics
headline: Learn how to use different techniques in marketing analytics and market mix models in this free online course.
description: Diploma in Marketing Analytics is a free online course that offers an in-depth understanding of R programming and other marketing tools. You will learn about the recommendation engines and the influence of demands and needs as well as wants on consumer's behaviour. You will also study customer segmentation and target positioning in marketing analytics. Register for this course today and take your marketing analytics skill to the next level.
courseDescription:
Diploma in Marketing Analytics is a free online course that offers a comprehensive guide to understanding the functions of different marketing mix models. This course will teach you how to use R programming, do social network analysis, and master other models for effective marketing analysis. It begins with a breakdown of consumers' wants and R programming, and how it can be used to solve real-life problems in marketing analytics.

Next, you will learn about customer segmentation and targeting positioning, along with geographical segmentation. You will also study demand focusing, pricing and major predictors of sales in marketing analytics. Then you will discuss the advertising models and how to use macro-level cost analysis in marketing mix models. Analyze situations where market decisions affect customers and study the recommendation engines and retail analytics in the marketing process. Finally, look into filtering and the features of collaborative filtering in marketing analytics.

This free online course provides practical knowledge and numerous applications of recency, frequency, monetary (RFM) value; market basket analysis; interactive dashboard creation as well as the customer-churn approach to ensure a great learning experience throughout. It will be of significant value to anyone interested in harnessing marketing analytics for personal or professional use. Start your next learning journey by registering for this course and upgrade your marketing analytics skills.

Start Course Now
certificateDetail:
All Alison courses are free to enrol study and complete. To successfully complete this course and become an Alison Graduate, you need to achieve 80% or higher in each course assessment. Once you have completed this course, you have the option to acquire an official Diploma, which is a great way to share your achievement with the world.

Your Alison is:
  • Ideal for sharing with potential employers
  • Include it in your CV, professional social media profiles and job applications.
  • An indication of your commitment to continuously learn, upskill & achieve high results.
  • An incentive for you to continue empowering yourself through lifelong learning.
Alison offers 3 types of Diplomas for completed Diploma courses:
  • Digital : a downloadable in PDF format immediately available to you when you complete your purchase.
  • : a physical version of your officially branded and security-marked , posted to you with FREE shipping.
  • Framed : a physical version of your officially branded and security marked in a stylish frame, posted to you with FREE shipping.

All are available to purchase through the Alison Shop. For more information on purchasing Alison , please visit our FAQs. If you decide not to purchase your Alison , you can still demonstrate your achievement by sharing your Learner Record or Learner Achievement Verification, both of which are accessible from your Dashboard. For more details on our pricing, please visit our Pricing Page

  • Lesson Summary 
    • Needs are all the basic necessities of human beings that are required for them to survive.
      For example, physical health, food, shelter, safety, and financial support
    • Consumer review data can be used to determine how consumer express themselves, as well as
      how to find out what their demands are 
    • Your profit function is a demand which is a function of price into price minus cost
    • Conjoint analysis is a quantitative technique that can be used to find out the various preferences
      of the customers, as well as how to get data on the preferences of various attributes
    • In marketing analytics, pricing can be done also through conjoint
      analysis
    • A brand premium is basically the extra money that a consumer is willing to pay because there is a brand written on the commodity 
    • Choice modeling is the process of empirically trying to create an econometric or
      quantitative model to actually find out how customers make a choice
    • If you have four options and the number of comparisons comes down, the results gotten from the outcome will be closer to the truth

  • Lesson Summary 
    • Segmentation, targeting, positioning is required because it becomes difficult for an individual or for some company to cater to many people
    • Segmentation methodology is the creation of smaller groups from a large  number  of consumers
    • The concept of geographic segmentation  is about a study of the behavior of people, how they eat, their culture, and other
    • It is important to know the role of various persons in the purchase decision-making process as it can be used to track a customer segmentation strategy
    • There are five different steps of segmentation, targeting, and positioning 
    • The actor analysis can be used to monitor consumers Behavior in marking, as well as segmentation, targeting, and positioning
    • Cluster analysis is a step that can also be used to determine the consumer's preference or behavior  
    • Data about people can be collected while doing segmentation targeting positioning
    • The consumer preference can be gotten from their behavior in segmentation and targeting positioning
    • To effectively focus on a group of customers, marketers should focus on market positioning, market segmentation, as well as market targeting

  • Upon completion of this module, you should be able to: 
    • Analyze the application of demand and sales forecasting in marketing analytics
    • Outline other related sales predictor in demand forecasting and pricing
    • Describe the application of a classic case of pricing in marketing 
    • List the features of the bundle pricing approach in forecasting 
    • Explain how to use analytics to forecast demand in marketing 
    • Describe the process of removing sales and seasonality part from the variable
    • Discuss the utilization of the technology adoption model as a forecasting technique

  • Lesson Summary 
    • Demand forecasting or sales forecasting is a technique that is used by another major predictor of sales
    • Bundling is applicable for the types of situations where there are multiple products that are peoples preferences which generally have a negative correlation
    • Its is possible to use analytics for the forecast demand in marketing as well as in, pricing and positioning 
    • The trend is the overall function of a particular thing either it is going up, going down, or coming down
    • Time series is a situation where a past occurrence is used to explain what will happen in the future 
    • Seasonality is a situation where a particular pattern repeats itself over a certain period of time in marketing processes 
    • A technology adoption model is a scenario where bass diffusion comes into the picture, as well as where there are products that belong to a product life cycle
    • The function is f(t) /[1 - F(t)]. This is the function of Bass diffusion model  f(t) /[1 - F(t)]= p + q F(t)
    • F(t) the formula is basically and S cumulative sales CS(t) = mF(t)

  • Lesson Summary 
    • Power block pricing is the pricing that the power or electricity companies generally adopt for their daily business activities
    • It is often suggested that consumer should go for multiple prices and if they analyze things, they might get bigger or better prices and make more profits
    • Price Segmentatationon is the use of different strategies for the same set of people coming at the same time. They are given better services at a better price and some lower services at a lower price
    • Markdown pricing is basically, where the consumer decides at a certain period to be given a lower price and find out that during the period, there are people who are more price-sensitive
    • Price bundling is used in a situation when there is a willingness to pay for two different products among various consumers
    • Price bundling is used in a situation when there is a willingness to pay for two different products among various consumers
    • If a product has a 30 % chance of lasting for 1 year that means if you have bought in this year you will have a 30 % that you will buy in the next year 
    • If a product has a 70 % chance of purchase for 2 years that means you have a 70 % chance that you will not buy in the next year

  • Lesson Summary 
    • Price is the only element in the marketing mix that produces revenue
    • Marketing mix modeling breaks down business metrics to differentiate contribution marketing and promotional marketing
    • Better allocation of market budget, better execution of ad campaigns, as well as business scenario testing are key benefits of marketing mix modeling
    • Elasticity shows how easy it is for the supplier and consumer to change their behavior as they substitute other goods, the strength of an incentive over choices per the relative opportunity
    • Marketing optimization is the process of improving the marketing efforts of an organization in an effort to maximize the desired business outcomes
    • The halo effect is a term for customers favoritism towards a product
    • Bias is the difference between the average predictions of a model and the actual value to be predicted
    • Linear regression is sensitive to outliers in the marketing analytics concept
    • If the demographic profiles for different channels or countries are different, then you have to bring in some complexities in modeling 
    • The Optim () is the function used for general-purpose optimization
